title: Apple Music Discord rich presence
description: A Discord rich presence for Apple Music

body.raw:
As a Apple Music user, missing out on the ability to show what I'm listening to on Discord was a bummer. So I decided to create a Discord rich presence for Apple Music.

Using the Apple Music API and being apart of Apple's developer program, I was able to create a Discord rich presence that shows the song, artist, and album art of the song you're currently listening to on Apple Music.

body.raw:
![CodeDevils](/projects/codedevils.png)

CodeDevils is a organization at Arizona State University that focuses on creating a community of software development enthusiasts. They host workshops, hackathons, and other events to help students learn and grow as developers and get involved in the tech community. So that hopefully they can get a job or internship in the tech industry.

My involvement with CodeDevils' website revamp has been through my time as a project manager and lead developer. I was tasked with leading the development of the revamped website, which included a complete redesign and reimplementation of the website using the Next.js framework. However, along with the redesign, I was also tasked with setting up a system to allow for members with no prior web development experience to contribute to the team through providing resources and documentation on how to contribute to the website.

Throughtout my time working on the website, I grow a lot as a web developer and learned how to lead teams to be successful no matter who is in it.

body.raw:
Like so many others, I just wanted a certized place on the internet to showcase my work. Maybe I'll add a blog, maybe I won't. I'm not sure yet.

If you like the design, check out the Repository on GitHub and star it ðŸ¤·ðŸ½â€â™‚ï¸

title: Discord Clone
description: A Discord clone built with Next.js 13, React, Socket.io, Prisma, Tailwind, MySQL

body.raw:
![Discord Clone](/projects/discord-clone.png)

With this project, I wanted to build a Discord clone using Next.js 13, React, Socket.io, Prisma, Tailwind, and MySQL and learn how to use Socket.io to build a real-time chat application.

This projects showcases my ability to build a full-stack application on short notice and my ability to learn new technologies quickly as I had never used Socket.io before building this project.

body.raw:
![CodeDevils Logo](/projects/docs.codedevils.png)

This project was for CodeDevils and it's members, for a couple of reasons, first was for the personal reason of wanting future developers of my projects to be able to easily understand how to use and add to them. As one of the biggest issues I had when i joined the CodeDevils' dev team was the lack of documentation for the projects I was working on. The second reason was to help the CodeDevils' dev team to have a central place to find documentation for all of the projects they work on.



With the development of this project, I was also able to teach members of CodeDevils about the importance of documentation and how to write it.

title: gopherphoenix.com
description: A local delivery service company in Phoenix, Arizona.

body.raw:
![Gopher Phoenix](/projects/gopherphoenix.com.png)

This Website, although not the most visually appealing looking back at it, was a great learning experience and was my first freelance project. I was hired by a local delivery service company in Phoenix, Arizona to create a website for them. The website was built using the Next.js framework and deployed on Vercel. The website was built with a mobile-first approach and is fully "responsive"(looking back, it wasn't fully responsive)

But although it's not my best work, it highlights my ability to learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks quickly. It also shows my ability to work with clients and deliver a product that meets their needs.

title: learn.codedevils.org
description: A LMS platform for students to learn and practice coding skills used by industry professionals.

body.raw:
With the rise of technology, the demand for software developers has increased. However, many students struggle to learn coding skills due to the lack of resources and guidance. To address this issue, while working for codedevils web development TemplateContext, we worked on developing a Learning Management System (LMS) platform called learn.codedevils.org. This platform provides students with the opportunity to learn and practice coding skills used by industry professionals and build projects to showcase their skills to potential employers.

My role within this project was to design and develop the frontend and backend of the platform using modern web technologies, such as  Next.js, Tailwind CSS, MySQL, and TypeScript. I also played a role in teaching members that were intrested about what goes into building full stack applications for the web.


## Features

- **Courses**: The platform offers a variety of courses on different programming languages and technologies, such as Python, JavaScript, React, and Node.js. Each course includes video lectures, quizzes, and coding exercises to help students learn and practice coding skills.

- **Projects**: Students can work on real-world projects to apply the skills they have learned in the courses. They can collaborate with other students and receive feedback from industry professionals to improve their projects.

- **Coding Challenges**: The platform also offers coding challenges to help students improve their problem-solving skills and prepare for technical interviews. Students can solve coding problems in different programming languages and receive instant feedback on their solutions.

- **Community**: Members could join CodeDevils' Discord server and participate in active discussions, ask questions, and share resources with other students and industry professionals. They can also attend virtual events, such as workshops and coding competitions, to network with like-minded individuals and gain hands-on experience.

- **Career Services**: The platform provides resources and guidance to help students prepare for job interviews and build a strong portfolio to showcase their skills to potential employers. Students can also access job listings and internship opportunities to kickstart their careers in software development.

title: Notion Clone
description: A Notion clone built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

body.raw:
In this project, I built a Notion clone using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. The app allows users to create, read, update, and delete pages. It also supports drag-and-drop functionality for reordering pages.

I created this project to practice building a full-stack application with Next.js and TypeScript. I also wanted to explore the drag-and-drop functionality, along with the trash can & soft delete feature.


## Features

- Create, read, update, and delete pages
- Drag-and-drop functionality for reordering pages
- Dark mode support
- Responsive design

title: wpcarey.asu.edu
description: W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University website

body.raw:
This website was built with Drupal 8, a content management system that allows for easy content updates and management. The website features a responsive design, making it accessible on a variety of devices, from desktop computers to smartphones.

While working for the W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University, I was responsible for managing the website content, ensuring that information was up-to-date and accurate. I also worked closely with the marketing team to develop new content and features to enhance the user experience.

![W. P. Carey School of Business at Arizona State University website](/projects/wpcarey.png)

title: clips
description: A video sharing platform built using Angular and Firebase.

body.raw:
Although when it comes to web applications, I have always been a React guy, I more then able to use other teachnologies for the need of a project. So, to show that I'm able to create a indutry standard web application using Angular, I decided to build a video sharing platform.

The application is called clips and it is built using Angular and Firebase. The application allows users to upload, watch, like, and comment on videos. The application also has a user authentication system that allows users to sign up, log in, and log out.
